body: @srkukarni @jerrypeng can you help look at this?

run integration tests
run java8 tests

Not an empty string, a null value. I'm not sure if a base64 encoded empty string works. I can test that later. Here is the null value property stack trace. I'll look to see if I can find the base64 nullpointerexception on payload.

@srkukarni I think you also need to check if the function result is null, don't call write on the sink
as I commented before, we should have python regex related function testing in integration tests. then we can prevent this kind of things happening again.

@sijie @jerrypeng I've changed IdentitySerDe to StringSerDe to better reflect what it's role is. Please take a look again.
Thanks!

@srkukarni why is the StringSerDe the default though?  As I mentioned in my previous comment,  if the default is StringSerDe, it will break if the user returns a class.  Shouldn't the default be the pickle serde that transforms all objects into bytes?
@jerrypeng Pickle format is very specific to Python. My main concern about making it default is that out of the box java and python functions will become illegible to each other.
@jerrypeng since python does not support schema yet, the above won't be possible because during deserialization, we won't know what to transform into.

@srkukarni gotcha we still need one serializer that can take care of primitive types as well as classes.  We can detect the type in python via type(object) and serialize accordingly.  Not sure how performant that will be though.

Using pickle might not be a bad thing for this before schema is implemented for python.  Its analogous to the java default serializer. Without schema its pointless to go between languages anyways, because you won't know the data type.
@grantwwu are you interested in submitting a PR fixing this?
close it due to inactivities, @dsambandam if you need more helps, please reopen it.
This bug has been fixed by #2088 and documentation is improved by #2174 and #2196
I think there is already available in current master
#2410 already bumped the version to latest jclouds release `2.1.1`
closed it due to inactivities. please reopen it if you can provide more details about the behavior.
@sholla can you provide more details about the errors you encountered?
@zhaijack anything we need to do for this task? if not, can we close it?

@jerrypeng I've added selective checks for IdentitySerDe. This kind of mimics the Java world as well as the very purpose of a default Serde. Please take a look again.
Thanks!
This has been implemented and available in master.
Yes, I can fix the immediate bugs.  But I also wanted to solicit thoughts about ways to bring tooling to check these automatically

@merlimat could you take another look? I have another patch with the CLI waiting for this to merge.

rerun cpp tests
rerun integration tests
@sijie its kinda put an expired tag on one message or lot of message directly?

> Skip validateOriginalPrincipal if proxyRoles is empty.

This could open up a security hole, as if the proxyRoles is empty, any client could then pass any value as the validateOriginalPrincipal, a therefore escalate their privileges.

> If originalPrincipal is null, treat a role as a "normal" client even when it is in proxyRoles.

The point of proxyRoles is to limit which roles can pretend to be other roles. Allowing proxyRoles to be ignored defeats this purpose.

The proxyRoles should be dedicated roles that are used for nothing but the proxy. I would consider anything else a bad configuration. Maybe we could improve the logging to make it clearer to the administrator that proxyRoles needs to be configured.

To restate what I said on other channels, the refactor should be broken out and submitted before the new code, as reviewing a refactor requires a different thought process to reviewing new code. It would be good if the new offloaders could each be in their own PRs so that each PR can be focussed on a single thing.
I'm currently adding documentation to security-tls-transport.md for hostname verification, and am stating that it doesn't work for C++. Please update the docs when this is fixed.

rerun integration tests
rerun cpp tests

Thanks your comments.

In producer/consumer proxied requests(not Admin REST API), we can use proxy without setting `proxyRoles` for now.
I have understood that as default behavior: 
https://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/security-authorization/#proxy-roles
> By default, the broker treats the connection between a proxy and the broker as a normal user connection.

* Should `proxyRoles` be mandatory when we use proxy?
* Is a role in `proxyRoles` not allowed to behave as a "normal" client?

> NullPointerException in the case of property values being null

This is related to protobuf, it does not support null-able field directly.
https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf/issues/1606

> Should proxyRoles be mandatory when we use proxy?

I think yes, as we give the proxy special abilities to spoof identity and this is a very powerful ability. However, my thinking on this is 100% TLS auth focussed, so I don't know how this interacts with athenz. Also, if auth is completely off between the proxy and broker, this would be unnecessary, though I don't know if this is currently the case.

But it would be good to get some other opinions. @merlimat @jai1 @joefk @massakam @sijie 

> Is a role in proxyRoles not allowed to behave as a "normal" client?

Also yes, modulo other opinions.
